SENT.plain: Cardiac sources of embolic stroke include various abnormalities of the atrial septum
An atypical detachment of the septum primum was detected in two patients by dynamic three-dimensional echocardiography (DTDE)
Between the septum primum and septum secundum a cavity with interatrial communication was detected
Within the cavity a turbulent color Doppler signal and an entry of the contrast agent EchovistR were detected
One of the patients suffered from repeated cerebrovascular events
This unusual defect of the atrial septum may be a potential source of embolism
Transesophageal echocardiography is considered the most sensitive method for the examination of the atrial septum
However, clear anatomic details could only be shown by DTDE
